body.p:
Head Quars 1" Ky. Battery.
Camp Fayettville, West. Va
March 11" 1864.
To his Excellency
The Govnor of Kentucky
Sir
I would respectfully submit the following to Your gracious consideration.

There has been appointed and commissioned as 1" Lieut in Simmonds 1" Indpt Ky. Battery of Light Artillery (over two (2) 2" Lieut who have seen service as officers over two (2) Years. one (1) of said Lieuts have commanded the Battery fourteen (14) or Eighteen (18) Month.) a Sergeant By name (Jas B. Flack) one of Capt Simmonds favorites as this Sergt has been one of the Capt principal agents in his on Government having been A. Q M. Sergeant when Capt Simmonds was act A. Q. M.
This Flack! Personally! -- is of very low origin. Lazy, Slovenish. and Dirty. he is as unprincipled as he is Dirty. he is a consummated Vilin, or at least a scheming Rascle.

He has done all in his power to discourage re-enlistments in the Battery. both by Example and advice. Though he proposed to the undersigned that if -- he could get a commission he himself would re-enlist.

These facts have been written to Genl Boyle, but it has had no Effect. Though they can and will be proven if this Man (Flack) should be Mustered. which is not the case yet, as the command is not entitled to an other Lieut. in it's present Diminished Number
Though there are but two (2) 2" Lieut now on Duty in the Command nor has there been for nearly twenty (20) Months
Hoping the above will meet your earliest attention and kind consideration

I have the honor to remain
With much Respect
Your Obdt Sevt
Danl W. Glassie
Lieut Comd'g 1" Ky Battery.

I would respectfully add that Capt Seth, J, Simmonds is and has been under arrest since the 19" Day of December 1863. And has been tried by Genl Court Martial for Dep-anding Govt &c and is now awaiting Sentence which if appeared will be cashiered.

Lieut Danl W. Glassie
Comd'g 1" Ky Battery.

1st Indept. Batty
Hd qrs. 1s Ky Indp' Battery
Fayetteville W. Va
March 11th 1864.
Glassie Danl W
Lt Comd Battery
To the Governor stating the character of James B. Flack appointed from sergt to 1s Lt over 2 2d Lt. says he is a scheming rascal and has done all he could against reenlistments
Refered to Adjt Genl
Look into this perhap the commission should be revoked.

T. E Bramlette.
See L. B. p. 327.
Recd A G. O 19th Mch 1864
